vainglory.description: Vainglory corrupts our good actions by doing them for human acclaim rather than for God's glory, making us slaves to others' opinions rather than true servants of God.

ambition.question: Did I allow my desire for power and dominance to influence how I interacted with others, particularly those in positions of authority or leadership?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

ambition.question: Did I allow my desire for power and dominance to influence how I treat others in my interactions, whether online or offline?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

ambition.question: Did my ambition to influence and lead others in our community gatherings, volunteer work, or family events sometimes cloud my judgment and intentions, leading me to prioritize my own desires over the needs and well-being of those around me?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

greed.question: Did I make accumulation of material possessions a driving force in my life, potentially leading me to prioritize them over trust in God's providence?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

oppression.question: Did you oppress, harass, or discriminate against others through your words and actions?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

envy.question: Have I ever felt envy towards others' successes, such as their careers, finances, or achievements?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

envy.question: Have I envied others' accomplishments and felt envious when they succeeded in areas where I had failed?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control in using words to disrespect others?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

prodigality.question: Have I been excessively reckless in prioritizing indulgences over my financial obligations and family needs?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

prodigality.question: Have I excessively indulged in spending on leisure activities, compromising my financial responsibilities to family and others?

prodigality.question: Have I excessively risked my financial resources, neglecting my responsibility to provide for myself and others in need?

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' faults or private affairs, even if what I shared was true, while engaging in conversations at social events, family gatherings, or online forums?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' personal matters, even if what I shared was true?

impiety.question: Did I use my talents, skills, and time on a Sunday when it otherwise could be avoided?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).
